results.title: Strategy for growth
results.brief_description: Describes UNICEF’s new policy to give more attention to the prevention of disability and to those children who are already disabled.

results.title: Oman today: the challenge
results.brief_description: Since the early seventies Oman has been involved in a development process that began with the opening of the country to the modern world. The role of UNICEF and other agencies, as well as specialists from other Arab countries is outlined.

results.title: Deciding a future
results.creator_credit: Edward King, William Hetzer and UNICEF
results.brief_description: UNICEF believes that a well organized and involved community that mobilizes itself for a change is performing a needed activity. This program shows how community participation has become an active means of development in Lima, Bangkok and New York.

results.title: Child's horizon
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of UNICEF in attempting to counter some of the causes of blindness in children: malnutrition, cataracts, infections and accidents. Also highlights factors that agravate the spread of disease - Poverty, ignorance, crowded living conditions, lack of clear water and poor sanitation.

results.title: Children of Soong Ching Ling
results.brief_description: Deals with the founding in China of orphanages and other welfare agencies to alleviate the suffering of millions of children. The social and cultural wellbeing of the children since 1948 are highlighted.

results.title: Child survival alliance
results.brief_description: Looks at Colombia’s massive attempt to immunize all its children. Three days a year are set aside by the government to give the children vaccines against polio, diptheria, whooping cough, tetanus and measles.

results.title: A Chance for children
results.creator_credit: Michael Craven, Thomas Craven Film Corporation and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Shows how breast feeding, growth charts, oral rehydration therapy and immunization are successful in lowering child mortality and provide millions of children with an improved quality of life.

results.title: Solar promise
results.creator_credit: Tom Putnam, Henry Mayer and Bullfrog Films
results.brief_description: Examines the use of solare energy for home heating. Active and passive systems are illustrated and the principles of each are outlined. A variety of homes are shown and the costs, advantages and potential for a wide range of climate conditions are fully covered. Reference is made to the indians of southwest America who understood and used passive solar heating.

results.title: Harmonic motion
results.brief_description: Surveys many timekeeping and other examples of harmonic motion and resonance. Shows how timekeeping let to improvements in our knowledge of harmonic motion. Also notes some mathematical applications.
